title: Self-Awareness
summary: Recognize and understand your own emotions, strengths, weaknesses, values, and motives.

details.content: Self-awareness is the foundation of emotional intelligence. It allows you to accurately assess your feelings and how they influence your thoughts and behavior, leading to better decision-making and personal growth.
Noticing that you feel anxious before a big presentation helps you prepare coping strategies, rather than being blindsided by nerves.

content: Keep a daily journal to reflect on your emotions and triggers.
Pause and name your feelings in the moment.
Ask for feedback from trusted friends or colleagues.
Practice mindfulness meditation to increase present-moment awareness.

title: Self-Regulation
summary: Manage and control your emotions, impulses, and reactions in healthy and constructive ways.

details.content: Self-regulation helps you respond thoughtfully rather than react impulsively, reducing conflict and stress while building trust with others.
Instead of snapping at a coworker when frustrated, you take a deep breath and calmly express your concerns.

content: Pause before responding when you feel strong emotions.
Use deep breathing or grounding techniques to calm down.
Reframe negative thoughts into more balanced perspectives.
Set clear intentions for how you want to act in challenging situations.

title: Motivation
summary: Harness your emotions to pursue goals with energy, persistence, and optimism.

details.content: Intrinsic motivation drives you to achieve goals for personal satisfaction, leading to greater fulfillment and resilience in the face of setbacks.
After failing an exam, you focus on your long-term goal of mastering the subject and create a new study plan instead of giving up.

content: Set meaningful, achievable goals and track your progress.
Celebrate small wins to maintain momentum.
Visualize success and connect tasks to your core values.
Remind yourself of your purpose during challenging times.

title: Empathy
summary: Understand and share the feelings of others, recognizing their perspectives and emotional states.

details.content: Empathy strengthens relationships, improves communication, and fosters compassion, making it easier to resolve conflicts and support others.
You notice a friend is unusually quiet and ask if they’re okay, listening attentively to their concerns.

content: Listen actively without interrupting or judging.
Pay attention to nonverbal cues like tone and body language.
Ask open-ended questions to understand others’ experiences.
Imagine yourself in someone else’s situation.

title: Social Skills
summary: Build and maintain healthy relationships, communicate effectively, and work well with others.

details.content: Strong social skills help you collaborate, resolve conflicts, and inspire others, contributing to personal and professional success.
You mediate a disagreement between team members by encouraging open dialogue and finding common ground.

content: Practice active listening and clear communication.
Give and receive constructive feedback.
Show appreciation and acknowledge others’ contributions.
Work on conflict resolution and negotiation skills.
